results.title: Love serenade
results.creator_credit: Saddleback Productions, AFFC, Jan Chapman and Shirley Barrett
results.brief_description: Two bored sisters Dimity and Vicki-Ann live in a small country town. Their new neighbour, a brooding self-centered radio personality arrives on the scene and threatens to turn their world upside down. Dimity and Vicki-Ann find themselves in competition for his affections as each develops a severe crush on the aging Lothario with a predilection for ‘70’s music and young women. Awarded the Camera D’Or at the 1996 Cannes Film Festival and starring Miranda Otto and Rebecca Frith (as the love-torn sisters) alongside George Shevtsov and John Alansu. Cinematography by Mandy Walker.

results.title: Love on the run = L'Amour en fuite
results.creator_credit: AMLF, Films du Carrosse and Francois Truffaut
results.brief_description: Fifth and final installment of Francois Truffaut’s “Antoine Doinel” cycle. Largely a series of flashbacks, this episode sees Antoine about to be divorced, and hence, reflective about his life. He is in love with Sabine but is filled with conflict about his responsibilities, in particular, his son, and is introspective the about the past. Aboard a train Antoine meets up with former love, Colette, and although they initially recall the past fondly, she subsequently berates Antoine for his lack of maturity and enduring self-absorption. This bittersweet work was largely derided as a disappointing end to an iconic series, but it maintains the lyricism and comical whimsy that are signatures of Truffauts “Doinel” work, whilst also being the most mediative.

results.title: Love nest
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Jules Buck and Joseph Newman
results.brief_description: When serviceman Jim Scott (William Lundigan) returns home after 2 1/2 years in the Army he finds his wife, Connie (June Haver), has bought a run down apartment block and assumed the role of landlady at 337 Grammercy Place. Eager to resume his writing, he soon learns that the landlord is always home, and with a suspected Casanova swindler as a tenant, and a jealous wife following the arrival of Jim’s beautiful Army buddy WAC Bobby (Marilyn Monroe), it will take something exceptional to get his writing off the ground and save the decrepit building from being condemned. Cast also includes Frank Fay, Leatrice Joy and Jack Parr. Based on the novel by Scott Corbett. Includes the original theatrical trailer.

results.title: Love me tender
results.creator_credit: Robert D Webb, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and David Weisbart
results.brief_description: Love Me Tender is most noteable for being Elvis Presley’s cinematic debut and the launching pad for one of his most recognisable hits Love Me Tender. The story of the Reno brothers starts at the end of the Civil War. Presley is Clint Reno a young farmer trying to keep the family farm running after the family are told that the oldest brother, Vance Reno has been killed in battle. Believing his brother is dead, Clint and Vance’s sweetheart Kathy marry. However, Vance returns with the intention of marrying Kathy. Clint receives reassurance from Vance that he bears no resentment towards the pair. However, the trios relationships with one another are soon tested when Vance is arrested and taken away for trial. This one event leads the trio to a climatic encounter that ends tragicly for all. While in the majority of the film Presley gets to display his acting ability the story is broken up with Presley singing and dancing.

results.title: Love me or leave me
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Joe Pasternak and Charles Vidor
results.brief_description: Show-casing her dramatic capabilities, Doris Day gives a surprising performance as the 1930’s torch singer Ruth Etting. Etting’s big break came when she was discovered by Chicago gangster Martin, “The Gimp” Snyder. Using the ruthless methods that he is accustomed to, the Gimp fulfills Ruth’s ambitions by providing her with material riches and renown on stage and screen. He also provides her with his hand in marriage. She pays a high cost personally however, living in an atmosphere of violence and fear that worsens when Martin discovers that Ruth has fallen in love with musician Johnny Alderman (Cameron Mitchell). Nominated for 6 Academy Awards, “Love me or leave me” is a departure from traditional musicals as it focuses on the trials and tribulations of love, fear and tragedy in relationships, played out against a backdrop of songs such as “Mean to me”, “Ten cents a dance” and “I’ll never stop loving you”. Cast also includes Robert Keith and Tom Tully.

results.title: Love lessons = Lust och Fagring Stor
results.creator_credit: Danske Filminstitut, Nordisk Films Kompagni, Svenska filminstitutet, Per Holst and Bo Widerberg
results.brief_description: Set in 1943 in Malmo (Sweden) ‘Love Lessons’ follows the sexual awakening of Stig (Johan Widerberg, the director’s son), a 15 year old student, with his teacher Viola (Marika Lagercrantz), 22 year his senior. At the beginning of the school year Stig is just one more adolescent, as ignorant as he is curious about women and sex. He develops an immediate crush on his new teacher, Viola, who is unhappily married to an alcoholic travelling salesman. Breaking every ethical code, Viola spends every afternoon giving Stig love lessons, until the day the young man meets Viola’s husband and becomes sympathetic to his plight. Sharing his time between a demanding lover and an unexpected friend, Stig’s life becomes even more complex when the young girl living next door directs her affection towards him. Feeling Stig’s love waning, Viola extracts a petty revenge on him, perhaps teaching the young man the ultimate love lesson: “hell hath no fury like a woman’s scorn”. Winner of the Silver Bear award at the Berlin Film Festival 1995. In Swedish with English subtitles.

results.title: Love laughs at Andy Hardy
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Robert Sisk and Willis Goldbeck
results.brief_description: This post-WWII film of the Hardy family reflects the true-life situation of Mickey Rooney as he plays G.I. Andy Hardy returning from his tour of duty at the war. The Hardy family represents the “typcial” stereotype American family with Andy a typical American teenager, interested in cars and girls, his stern but understanding father Judge James Hardy (Lewis Stone) and his dear loving mother Mrs Hardy (Fay Holden). When Andy finds himself falling for the lovely college co-ed Kay Wilson (Bonita Granville), little does he realise what disappointments lay ahead. Delightful, light-hearted romantic comedy based on the characters created by Aurania Rouverol. Cast also includes Sara Haden, Lina Romay and Dorothy Ford.

results.title: Love is the devil: study for a portrait of Francis Bacon
results.creator_credit: BBC Film Unit, BFI, Chiara Menage and John Maybury
results.brief_description: Love is the Devil: A Study For A Portrait of Francis Bacon is indeed a portrait in the style of controversial British painter Bacon. Like Bacon’s confronting yet compelling portraits, John Maybury’s film intensely focuses on its subject - revelling in distortion and pain. The film follows the turbulent, sado-masochistic relationship Bacon (Derek Jacobi) had with George Dwyer (Daniel Craig), who he meets when he accidently stumbles upon Dwyer attempting to burgle Bacon’s meagre apartment. Francis simply says to George: “Take off your clothes. Come to bed and you can have whatever you want”. The relationship has a destructive effect on the passive George who feels uncomfortable with Bacon’s eccentric friends (Tilda Swinton is especially creepy as one of this coterie), and who is continually tortured by Bacon’s sadistic enjoyment of pain and suffering. Derek Jacobi and Daniel Craig are excellent as the two main characters.

results.title: Love is a many-splendored thing = Love is a many splendored thing [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Buddy Adler and Henry King
results.brief_description: Adapted from the novel by Han Suyin, “Love is a many splendored-thing” is a film about an inter-racial romance, shot on location in Hong Kong and filmed in Cinemascope. Set in Hong Kong 1949, the film centres on the love affair of Dr Han Suyin (Jennifer Jones) and Mark Elliot (William Holden). She is a dedicated and talented doctor of Eurasian background, working in a local hospital, who longs for her Chinese homeland. He is an American war correspondent covering the Korean War, temporarily based in Hong Kong. When Suyin meets Elliot she is alerted to the fact that he is married and is warned that a cross-cultural relationship is a perilous move. The racism and snobbery of the British social network of Hong Kong is made clear, particularly in the initial stages of the film. The expectations of Suyin’s Chinese family and colleagues are that she will behave in the culturally expectant Chinese way. Suyin is proud of her Eurasian heritage but is also made acutely aware of her cultural difference and status as an outsider, despite being respected professionally. Winner of three Academy Awards, including Best Song.

results.title: Love and death
results.creator_credit: Jack Rollins & Charles H. Joffe Productions, Charles H. Joffe and Woody Allen
results.brief_description: Who else but Woody Allen would invade the land and spirit of Tolstoy and have audiences laughing all over the world? Meet Boris Grushenko (Allen), the son of a farmer in the Eighteenth Century Russia in hot pursuit of the meaning of life… and his sultry cousin Sonja (Diane keaton). Along the way, such soul-searching questions are posed as “if Christ was a carpenter, what would he charge for bookshelves?” and perhaps more importantly “Are there girls after death?” Boris reluctantly enlists during the Napoleonic Wars. Hilarious twists of fate lead Boris into battle, inadvertant heroism, bedroom escapades and a scheme to kill Napoleon himself. With its visually impressive and historical setting, this film is a comedy of epic proportions. Also stars Jessica Harper. Written by Woody Allen.
